intro: Matelea carolinensis, commonly known as the Carolina mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas. It is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in humid, shaded conditions.
